space.arim.universal.registry

Class UniversalRegistry

  • java.lang.Object
    • space.arim.universal.registry.UniversalRegistry

  • public final class UniversalRegistry
extends Object
    UniversalRegistry: Main class

    Used for registering all services, as well as checking/listing registrations.

    The most common usage of this class is to register resources and retrieve registrations.
    To register resources: register(Class, Registrable)
    To retrieve registrations: getRegistration(Class)

    To retrieve an instance:
    * get()
    * getByClass(Class)
    * threadLocal()
    * getOrDefault(Class, Supplier)
    Author:
    A248

      • DEFAULT_ID

        public static final String DEFAULT_ID
        The main instance id

        Equivalent to UniversalEvents.DEFAULT_ID
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • threadLocal

        public static ThreadLocal<UniversalRegistry> threadLocal()
        UniversalRegistry instances are thread-safe; however, you may wish for a thread-specific instance nonetheless.
        Returns:
        ThreadLocal - a ThreadLocal

      • getByClass

        public static UniversalRegistry getByClass(Class<?> clazz)
        Retrieves a UniversalRegistry instance by class. If no instance for the classname exists, a new one is created.

        This is the preferred approach to using your own UniversalRegistry instances.
        Parameters:
        clazz - - the class
        Returns:
        UniversalRegistry - the instance. If none exists, a new instance is created.

      • getOrDefault

        public static UniversalRegistry getOrDefault(Class<?> clazz,
                                             Supplier<UniversalRegistry> defaultSupplier)
        Gets a UniversalRegistry by class with a default value, issued by the Supplier, if it does not exist.

        This method is useful for checking for a specific instance and falling back to a default value.
        Parameters:
        clazz - - see getByClass(Class)
        defaultSupplier - - from which to return back default values.
        Returns:
        UniversalRegistry - a registered instance if the id exists, otherwise the default value

      • get

        public static UniversalRegistry get()
        Gets the main instance of UniversalRegistry
        Returns:
        UniversalRegistry - the instance

      • getId

        public String getId()
        Returns the id of this UniversalRegistry instance.

        The current implementation:
        * For the main instance, it is DEFAULT_ID
        * For classname instances retrieved with getByClass(Class), it is "class-" followed by the classname
        * For thread-local instances retrieved with threadLocal(), it is "thread-" + System.currentTimeMillis() at instantiation time of the corresponding UniversalEvents + "-" + the thread name
        However, these values may change.
        Returns:
        String - the id

      • getEvents

        public UniversalEvents getEvents()
        Gets the UniversalEvents instance corresponding to this registry.

        The returned UniversalEvents instance is the same one on which RegistrationEvents are fired.
        Returns:
        UniversalEvents - the accompanying events instance

      • register

        public <T extends Registrable> void register(Class<T> service,
                                             T provider)
        Register a resource as a specific service
        Type Parameters:
        T - - the service
        Parameters:
        service - - the service class, e.g. Economy.class for Vault economy
        provider - - the resource to register, cannot be null

      • unregister

        public <T extends Registrable> void unregister(Class<T> service,
                                               T provider)
        Unregister a resource
        Type Parameters:
        T - - the service
        Parameters:
        service - - the service class
        provider - - the resource to unregister

      • isProvidedFor

        public <T extends Registrable> boolean isProvidedFor(Class<T> service)
        Checks whether a service has any accompanying provider

        This method should only be called in the rare case where you need to check whether a service is registered but you do not need to retrieve the registration itself.

        If you need to retrive a registration use getRegistration(Class)
        Type Parameters:
        T - - the service
        Parameters:
        service - - the service class
        Returns:
        true if the service is provided for, false if not

      • getRegistration

        public <T extends Registrable> T getRegistration(Class<T> service)
        Retrieves the highest-priority registration for a service.

        The proper way to retrieve registrations is to call this method once, check if the returned value is non-null. If not null, proceed normally. If null, there is no registration for the service. (You could then print an explanatory error message)

        Do not use isProvidedFor(Class) and then this method, or you may experience concurrency problems.
        Type Parameters:
        T - - the service
        Parameters:
        service - - the service class
        Returns:
        the service asked.

      • getRegistrations

        public <T extends Registrable> List<T> getRegistrations(Class<T> service)
        Retrieves all registrations for a service.

        If there are no registrations for the service parameter, an empty list is returned. Otherwise, the returned list is backed by the internal registry.
        Type Parameters:
        T - - the service
        Parameters:
        service - - the service class
        Returns:
        immutable list sorted according to priority of registrations. Empty if no registrations exist.

      • getRegistrations

        public Map<Class<?>,List<Registrable>> getRegistrations()
        Retrieves a the map of service types to registrations backed by the internal registry.

        Changes to the internal registry are reflected in the map
        Returns:
        a map of service classes to registrable lists
